items.sentence: What we all have in common is that we love soccer.

Mary needed a dress, so her mother bought her one.
I didn't want to know what Tom was planning to do.
Even though Tom said that he was happy, he wasn't.
The talks will deal with the problem of pollution.
Once upon a time, there was a bad king in England.
Both of my parents were brought up in the country.
The typhoon struck the city, causing great damage.
Radishes might be more expensive than the carrots.
The large audience clapped at the end of the song.
The rebels have captured the broadcasting station.
Choosing between different brands of beer is hard.

We watched the movie and then had dinner together.
Don't buy overripe fruit. It goes bad really fast.
I wish that my French was as good as your English.
